definition: to gather/to collect/collected works/classifier for sections of a TV series etc: episode

sentences.english: Hugely promising, but its sequels have fallen far short.
sentences.chinese: 非常地有前景，但它的续集们却与之差距很大。

sentences.english: No wonder they love it and are longing for more.
sentences.chinese: 难怪她们如此爱它，而且渴望更多的续集。

sentences.english: Saldana also confirmed that shooting will begin early next year.
sentences.chinese: 索尔达娜还说续集将于明年初开拍。

sentences.english: John Corbett thinks there will be a 'Sex and the City 3' movie.
sentences.chinese: 约翰科比特认为电影《欲望都市》会拍续集三。

sentences.english: Old franchises birthed promising new sequels that turned hours of play into days.
sentences.chinese: 老了有前途的新专营权续集将发挥天小时。

sentences.english: We watched the sequel to "Spiderman" on TV.
sentences.chinese: 我们在电视上看了蜘蛛人的续集。

sentences.english: How were you selected to write the first-ever authorized sequel to Peter Pan?
sentences.chinese: 你是怎样被授权写《小飞侠彼得潘》的续集的？

sentences.english: The sequel *always* sucks compared to the sequel in our heads.
sentences.chinese: 跟我们想象的续集比起来，续集总是很烂。

sentences.english: The sequel *always* sucks compared to the sequel in our heads.
sentences.chinese: 跟我们想象的续集比起来，续集总是很烂。

sentences.english: The sails have been stowed on the next "Pirates of the Caribbean" sequel.
sentences.chinese: 《加勒比海盗》下一部续集的筹拍计划已经提上日程。

sentences.english: The lovable high kicking Panda must battle a new evil in the sequel.
sentences.chinese: 可爱的高踢腿熊猫在续集里必须跟新的邪恶作斗争。

sentences.english: Will there be a Mount & Blade sequel besides this multiplayer expansion?
sentences.chinese: 将有一个山及叶片续集除此之外多人扩大？

sentences.english: It has spawned two successful sequels and a vast array of merchandising.
sentences.chinese: 之后又成功地推出了两篇续集，带来了巨大的商机。

sentences.english: The reign of Christ over mankind will be the sequel of the General Judgment.
sentences.chinese: 腥风血雨的基督超过人类，将在续集中的一般判断。

sentences.english: And Pixar does not look at sequels as a financial plan.
sentences.chinese: 皮克斯并不把续集看作是种商业计划。

definition: to reproduce photographically/to duplicate/to adapt (as a movie)/to remake (a movie)/adaptation/reproduction/remake
to begin shooting (a movie, a scene of a movie etc)/to start the bidding (auction)/to start a trading session (stock market)
to prepare to film/to plan a shoot
cast (of a movie etc)/lineup of performers/troupe
theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe
